sense.name: Ruin completely; smash or break (open) forcefully.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] BUST NP2[patient] INCLUDES: BUST UP, BUST OPEN
sense.examples: He busted my radio. The kid busted up the car. Toshiba busted open that sector this summer.

sense.name: Search without warning; make a sudden surprise attack on.
sense.examples: The police busted the crack house. Cops busted the drug dealer upstairs last night.

sense.name: Escape.
sense.examples: John busted out of Mary's basement. The prisoners busted out of jail.

sense.name: Break open or apart suddenly and forcefully; separate or cause to separate; go to pieces.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[patient] BUST (open) NOTE: Compare to Sense 1; Sense 4 does not include an AGENT. INCLUDES: BUST OPEN
sense.examples: The dam busted. The gears finally busted. The mower busted yesterday on the lawn. The pillow busted open during the fight. The old chair finally busted completely.
